name: Young-Kyoon Suh
content: BiographySearch this siteEmbedded FilesSkip to main contentSkip to navigationYoung-Kyoon Suh, Ph.D., is an Associate Professor in the School of Computer Science and Engineering at Kyungpook National University (KNU), Daegu, Korea. He is also a Vice Manager of the BK FOUR Intelligence Convergence Software Education Research Group in the same school. He served as the Director of the Center for Gifted Education at Kyungpook National University. He is currently leading Big Data & AI Convergence (DAC) Lab. He holds a Ph.D. degree (Advisor: Prof. Richard T. Snodgrass) in Computer Science from the University of Arizona, USA. Phone: +82-53-950-6372 Email: yksuh at knu dot ac dot kr Office: Rm. 520, IT-5 (Bldg. #415), Kyungpook National University, Daegu, 41566 Republic of KoreaResearch InterestsDatabases, Big Data, Data Science, Data Mining, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Storage Systems, Performance EvaluationEducationPh.D., Department of Computer Science, the University of Arizona, USA (2015)M.S., School of Computing, KAIST, Korea (2005)B.S., School of Computer Science & Engineering, Kyungpook National University, Korea (2003)PublicationsRefer to my lab website (google scholar).AwardsBest Paper Awards: KSC'21 (Outstanding Journal by the Computer System Society of KIISE), KSC'20 (Outstanding Paper), KDBC'20 (Bronze Prize), KDBC'19 (Silver Prize), BigDas'17, and EDB'16.Best Poster Award at ACM/IEEE CCGrid'16.Service Award by National Research Foundation of Korea, 2016.Travel Grant Award at the University of Arizona,
